meanings.definition: To put in a particular position or location.
meanings.sent1: She placed the book on the table.
meanings.sent2: He placed the cup on the shelf.
meanings.sent3: The cat placed its paw delicately on the toy mouse.
meanings.sent4: The sun placed its warm rays on the field.
meanings.sent5: The teacher placed the star sticker on the student's paper.

meanings.definition: To set or arrange in a particular way.
meanings.sent1: They placed the chairs in a circle for the meeting.
meanings.sent2: The chef placed the ingredients neatly on the counter.
meanings.sent3: The child placed the toys in a line from big to small.
meanings.sent4: The artist placed the colors on the palette with care.
meanings.sent5: The gardener placed the flowers in a beautiful pattern.

meanings.definition: To assign a particular rank or position to.
meanings.sent1: The coach placed her as the team captain.
meanings.sent2: The manager placed him in charge of the project.
meanings.sent3: The teacher placed the student at the front of the class.
meanings.sent4: The judge placed the verdict in favor of the plaintiff.
meanings.sent5: The director placed her as the lead actress in the play.
